The method measures the total height of each fiber lot and determines a partial quantity to be removed, which is then removed in a single pass. The apparatus includes a fiber removing device, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the operation of the fiber removing device. The control device can be programmed to remove the partial quantity within a predetermined time period or to adjust the removal rate to ensure that the partial quantity is removed within the time period.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention provides a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, where yarns are laid at an angle to the direction of fabric formation, and a rake system is used to accept and retain the yarns at the end of their travel, allowing for parallelism and overlap of successive courses. The rake system can be adjusted to control the density of the fabric by varying the amount of overlap between courses, and the speed of the conveyor can be adjusted to control the speed of fabric formation.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, where air under pressure is ejected from main nozzles and subnozzles to produce different weft carrying forces suited for the different weft threads. The invention allows for the selection of the appropriate weft carrying force for each weft thread, reducing air consumption and improving the stability of the weft insertion process.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibers, such as jute, kenaf, and hemp, into yarns with low end breakage rates. The process involves health preserving the fibers, opening, cleaning, and carding them, and then spinning them into yarns. The health preserving step is crucial in improving the flexibility and spinnability of the fibers, resulting in yarns with reduced end breakage rates. The invention also includes examples of blended spinning bast fibers with other fibers, such as cotton, terylene, and polypropylene, to produce yarns with improved properties.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which is used to exert pressing forces on webs for forming paper, textile material, plastic foil, and other related materials. The sensing roll has multiple sensors disposed along its length, with each sensor measuring the pressure exerted on it as it enters the nip region. The sensors are spaced apart circumferentially on the roll, with each sensor measuring the pressure at a particular cross-directional position. The sensors can be arranged in a helical pattern around the roll, with each sensor measuring the pressure at a different rotational position. The sensors can be used to calculate and display the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile of the press. The sensing roll can be used in a nip press with a second roll to produce pressure on a fibrous web, with the sensing roll and second roll rotating to advance the web through the nip region. The sensing roll can be used to monitor the condition of the roll and make adjustments to the nip pressure profile to achieve uniform sheet characteristics.

<summary>
The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board. The cord support has a flexible mast with a foot that can be pivoted to a raised or retracted position. The article holder has a detachable design and can be attached to the cord support. The cord support has a clamp that can be secured to the ironing board, and the article holder has a second support that can be secured to the clamp. The invention also includes an electrical outlet that can be mounted to the cord support. The cord support has a coiled spring resilient section that allows it to be easily moved between the raised and retracted positions. The article holder has a base and a pair of support bars that define a circle for retaining an article. The invention is designed to provide a convenient and organized way to iron and store articles while ironing.

<summary>
The invention is a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can be used to select the length of a buttonhole and ensure that it is sewn correctly regardless of the type of material being used. The device includes a foot pad that attaches to the presser bar and a travelling assembly that moves with the work being sewn. The travelling assembly has a slidable member that can be positioned by a button and carries a tab that actuates a tripping lever on the machine to limit the length of the buttonhole. An adjustable stop on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of the buttonhole. The device is designed to prevent the formation of open buttonholes or those with overlapping stitches. The operator can adjust the stop to compensate for different materials that may slip at different rates during sewing. The device is suitable for use with various types of sewing machines, including the "TOUCH-TRONIC" 2001 electronic sewing machine manufactured by The Singer Company.

<summary>

The invention is a fabric treatment apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid. The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The conveyor is an endless sieve belt that transports the textile web along a predetermined path. The liquid applicator applies the liquid to the web during its motion along the path. The suction device removes the liquid from the web by suction during its motion along the path. The dwell stretch is a section of the path where the web is guided in a spread-out condition and in a single layer, allowing the liquid to act on the substances to be removed from the web for a longer period. The apparatus can be used for various types of fabric treatment, including washing and rinsing, and can be particularly useful for treating knitted fabrics.

</summary>

<summary>

The dry cleaning machine has a separate air flow system that brings ambient air into the access opening of the machine whenever the door is opened, preventing the escape of solvent vapors. The air flow system includes a blower, valves, and hoses that direct the air flow through the machine. The machine also has a solvent flow system that recirculates the solvent through the machine, including a filter and a button trap to remove particles and contaminants. The solvent flow system is designed to minimize the loss of solvent vapors and prevent the formation of streaks and swales on the clothes. The machine also has a refrigeration system that cools the solvent in the storage tank to a predetermined temperature, and a timer that controls the various cycles of the machine. The machine has a "cartridge dry" mode that allows the filters to be dried and cleaned without rotating the tub or advancing the timer. The machine's controls include a door switch, a control box switch, and a "cartridge dry" switch that allows the machine to be operated in a special mode for drying the filters.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly for making nonwoven webs. The apparatus includes a quench chamber where the filaments are cooled and drawn, and an impingement point slot where the filaments are drawn to a desired denier. The filaments are then collected on a web forming table and formed into a nonwoven web. The invention allows for the production of fine filaments with a denier of under 5, and can produce webs with a basis weight of under 5 grams per square meter.
</summary>

<summary>

The sewing machine described in the text is equipped with an ultrasonic pen that can detect a position on a work cloth using ultrasonic waves. The ultrasonic pen is used to specify a position on the work cloth where sewing is to be performed. The sewing machine has two receivers that detect the ultrasonic waves transmitted from the ultrasonic pen and calculate the position of the pen tip based on the detected waves. The receivers are positioned in a way that satisfies certain conditions to ensure accurate detection of the ultrasonic waves. The sewing machine uses the calculated position to perform sewing. The ultrasonic pen is designed to transmit ultrasonic waves when the pen tip is pressed against the work cloth, and the receivers detect the waves and calculate the position. The sewing machine can accurately identify the specified position and perform sewing accordingly.

</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material to enhance its utility. The preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, where the wool particles or wool powder carry functional additives. The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below. The preparation can also comprise a mixture of powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents. The functional additives can include anti-UV agents, anti-bacterial agents, and other comparable agents. The preparation can be applied onto the fabric using various methods, such as printing, padding, or foam application. The treated fabric can exhibit improved properties, including ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, and wrinkle recovery. The invention also includes methods for preparing the preparation and applying it to the fabric. The treated fabric can be used in various applications, including clothing, textiles, and other materials.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is an automatic quilting machine that allows for the sewing of patterns into large fabrics such as bedspreads and quilts. The machine has a separate process controller that controls the movement of the quilting table in the X and Y directions, and a separate process controller that controls the sewing machine head. This allows for the reprogramming of the table movement without affecting the sewing machine functions, making it easier to modify patterns and reduce production time.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image. The fabric is formed by hydroentangling a precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second fibrous matrix, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim in between. The precursor web is advanced onto a moveable imaging surface of an image transfer device, which defines three-dimensional elements against the web. The first fibrous matrix is displaced into the three-dimensional topography, while the second fibrous matrix is retained on the side away from the topography. The fabric can be used in various applications, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and industrial uses. The invention provides a durable nonwoven fabric with a pronounced three-dimensional image and improved performance properties.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, which includes a control setup that includes a stop in the feed path of the strip that can be moved into the path and retracted by a lever, and a control cam that controls the movement of the lever. The device allows for a continuous operation and is insensitive to disturbances, making it suitable for sewing stiff strips of material, such as those used in the manufacture of automobile seat slipcovers.

<summary>
The invention is a connective knitting method that joins two tape-shaped knit pieces by overlaying loops and binding off the overlaid loops, allowing for a seamless join without the need for separate sewing. The method uses a flat knitting machine with multiple needle beds that can move in a longitudinal direction to create the joined knit fabric.

<summary>
The invention relates to a flexible traction element with stranded cables, a production line for producing such traction elements, and a method for embedding stranded cables with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material. The traction element has a flexible thermoplastic plastics material jacket and stranded cables with a core strand and peripheral strand cords. The production line includes a system for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, an extruder for sheathing the stranded cables with the plastics material, and a cooling trough for cooling the traction element. The method involves unwinding the stranded cables, degreasing and preheating the stranded cables, sheathing the stranded cables with the plastics material, and cooling the traction element. The invention provides a traction element with improved flexibility, tensile strength, and adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket. The production line and method can be used to produce traction elements with stranded cables of different diameters and with different numbers of stranded cables.

<summary>
The invention is a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that aims to minimize the impediment of the thread movement during the guiding of the needle thread loop around the bobbin housing. The arrangement includes a spring rod that extends between two cams and cooperates with a projection of the bobbin housing to prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing. The capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod, allowing the needle thread loop to move unhindered. The invention provides a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, resulting in good sewing properties and reduced needle thread tension.

<summary>

The invention describes a method for producing silicon-based nanowires and materials using liquid silane inks. The method involves combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent to form a viscous solution, which is then expelled through a nozzle and exposed to a high electric field to form continuous fibers. The fibers are deposited onto a substrate and can be transformed using thermal or laser processing to produce polysilane, amorphous silicon, or crystalline silicon materials. The invention also describes the use of five-component inks that include a solid phase component, such as a particulate, photoactive, or reactive compound. The resulting nanowires can be used as a component of composite materials, such as an anode material for a lithium ion battery.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel, which allows for simultaneous control of thread tension for the entire array and individual spool holders. The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each connected to a different spool holder, and a biasing arrangement that is activated by fluid pressure and connected to the tensioning lever. The biasing arrangement is designed to operate in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, allowing for centralized control of thread tension and rapid braking action when the warping machine is shut off. The invention also includes a magnetic system that can be used as an alternative to the friction brake, which generates eddy currents in a braking disc to produce a braking effect.

<summary>
The present invention is a sewing machine detector that uses a novel design to overcome the limitations of conventional detectors, including the use of stationary reflecting portions, linearly supported optical fibers, and a compact and cost-effective design. The detector is capable of detecting sewing machine control signals, including needle position, speed, and thread trimmer timing, with high accuracy and stability, despite shaft vibration and other environmental factors.

<summary>
The invention is a process for producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, which involves a simplified and accelerated process that includes partial coagulation, completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying. The process achieves a high degree of whiteness without the need for additional bleaching treatments, and can be carried out at high spinning speeds, making it more economical and efficient than traditional methods.

<summary>
The invention is a deaeration tank for pulp that is designed to remove oxygen from the pulp after it has been treated with oxygen. The tank is a small, cylindrical vessel with an open top and a flat bottom, and it has an inlet pipe that carries the pulp into the tank. The pulp is swirled by a filtrate from the washer, which enters the tank through a swirler inlet. The tank is designed to be compact and easy to install, and it can be mounted on top of or hung from the side of the oxygen reactor. The deaeration tank is designed to operate at atmospheric pressure or under vacuum, and it can be built to withstand pressures of ±1 atmosphere. The tank is controlled by a height sensor that regulates the flow of pulp out of the tank based on the height of the pulp in the tank.

<summary>

The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The BTR composite is designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which involves optimizing the material's structure and properties for specific functions. The composite consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and joints, which are arranged in a specific pattern to provide maximum structural performance. The stuffer members can be made of various materials, including ceramic, metal, or plastic, and can be hollow or solid. The tendon elements can be made of carbon fibers, nylon, or other suitable materials and can be bent or straight. The composite can be used in various applications, including aerospace, automotive, and marine industries. The invention also includes various embodiments, such as curved and flat panels, and different stuffer and tendon element arrangements. The BTR composite can be optimized for specific functions, such as supporting static loads, dissipating vibration energy, or absorbing impact energy.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during a dynamic event, such as an earthquake. The device is designed to be attached to a braced frame structure and can undergo plastic deformation to absorb and dissipate energy. The device has a connection means that attaches it to the braced frame structure and can be removed and replaced after a dynamic event. The device is designed to limit the loads on the structure and prevent catastrophic failure, and can be used in various shapes and sizes to accommodate different structural applications.
</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet that provides a flophouse facility with individual rooms on the floor of an existing building. The bedroom cabinet is designed to have a floor area equal to a bed, a height that allows a user to sit up, and a circumference that is completely shut off from the outside except for a doorway. The cabinet is designed to be assembled and installed on-site, and can be stacked or installed adjacent to each other to maximize floor space. The cabinet has an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between the two that can be used to house electric devices or shelves. The outer casing has a flat surface and is formed with a notch for the doorway, while the inner casing has a front panel with an opening for the doorway and a mat on the bottom. The cabinet also has a box for a TV receiver, a box for an interphone, and a box for a clock or radio receiver. The cabinet is designed to be sound-proof and has a venting system to provide natural ventilation. The second embodiment of the cabinet has a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing over the entire surface, with spacer members that can be adjusted to provide the required strength. The cabinet can be used as a flophouse or as a bedroom, and can be customized with various devices and features. The invention provides a convenient and practical solution for providing individual rooms in a shared space.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in construction sites. The support consists of a flat base plate, an upright column, and a retaining flange, which can be secured to a floor or ground surface. The support has rail supporting brackets and an angular brace to provide stability and support for wooden guard rails and kickboards. The invention allows for easy installation and removal of the guard rail assembly, and can be used in various situations, such as around the perimeter of a floor slab, roof structure, or bridge construction. The guard rail support is designed to meet safety regulations and can be used in conjunction with a mesh-like fence structure. The invention provides a durable and reusable solution for providing a safe working environment on construction sites.

<summary>

The invention is a pulsed power device and method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) that uses a combination of electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) discharges to stimulate oil-bearing reservoirs. The device is designed to generate high-frequency acoustic vibrations in the reservoir, which can stimulate oil production and increase recovery. The EH discharge creates a plasma channel that vaporizes water, generating a shockwave that travels through the reservoir, while the EM discharge generates a magnetic pulse that induces high-frequency acoustic vibrations in the reservoir. The device can be deployed in a single well or multiple wells, and can be controlled to generate energy pulses in specific directions and frequencies. The invention also includes improvements to the design of the electrodes and the discharge section to improve efficiency and extend the life of the device. The device can be used in a variety of applications, including oil recovery, geophysical exploration, and precision demolition. The invention also includes a multi-level tool that allows for time-sequential and variable inductance discharges, and a directional energy cone that can be used to focus the energy pulses in specific directions. The device can be used in a variety of formations, including cased and uncased wells, and can be controlled remotely from the surface. The invention is designed to be more effective and efficient than existing EOR methods, and can be used to recover more oil from existing fields.

</summary>

<summary>The present disclosure describes a system and method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length, which includes a first wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a second wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive transverse wires of a grid-strip. The system allows for the extension of the soil reinforcing element's length by coupling multiple grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element using the splices, enabling the creation of a composite soil reinforcing element with a desired reinforcing distance from a vertical facing.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection. The plow blade includes a blade, leading edge sections, and a fluid tube that defines flow paths for fluid to exit the blade at controlled locations and with a controlled flow rate. The fluid pressure can be varied by adjusting the length of the fluid tube and the number of leading edge sections. The plow blade can be tailored to provide fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements. The components are manufactured with traditional manufacturing processes, and the flow paths are defined by stacking together leading edge sections with flow voids and welding or otherwise attaching them to a blade. The invention provides a plow that can be easily modified and maintained.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a building system and method for creating a stucco wall with a cavity wall construction, allowing for larger panels without movement control joints. The system includes a frame or substructure, battens, a first mesh attached to the battens, a second mesh supported by the plaster matrix, and a plaster matrix that penetrates the first mesh and embeds the second mesh. The invention also includes various flashing members and mesh reinforcement to provide additional support and protection. The method involves applying plaster to the battens and mesh, and then overlaying the plaster with additional mesh and flashing members to create a reinforced stucco wall.
</summary>

<summary>The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure that provides a secure and simple locking mechanism, with a door that is received in a groove formed by bar members and a lockbolt that is reinforced by safety bolts to prevent damage from prying. The safe can be constructed using a variety of materials, including concrete and steel, and can be designed to be more economical by reducing the number of bar members used.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a formation fluid pressure sensing system that measures the pressure of a fluid in a geological formation at a specific depth. The system includes a borehole, a grout pipe, a filter, a pressure transducer, and a check valve. The grout pipe is used to fill the borehole with a cement grout material, and the filter is used to prevent cement grout particles from entering the pressure transducer. The pressure transducer is connected to the filter and is used to measure the pressure of the fluid in the formation. The system is designed to isolate the pressure transducer from the fluid pressure above and below the filter, allowing for accurate measurement of the formation fluid pressure.
</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to the tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given the maintenance. The jointing structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap. The elastic members are designed to be hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner. The joint block is mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap, and the joint block and the elastic members are fitted in detachable fashion. The jointing structure is designed to prevent the occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations by decentralizing the expansion gap in the joint between the bridge girders into more than one smaller-width expansion gap with the joint block. The jointing structure is also designed to absorb the expansion or contraction of the bridge girders caused by temperature changes or the like.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a floor track system for transporting hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber, such as a meat processing plant. The system prevents the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated. The track system includes a wheel channel with a cover plate that can be pivoted away for cleaning. The channel is designed to accommodate hand trucks with horizontally axled wheel structures or those with downwardly depending struts. The system also includes inflatable seals that can be deflated to allow the hand trucks to move along the track. The track system is designed to prevent corrosion of the hand truck wheel bearings and deterioration of the rubber wheels. The system allows for the recirculation and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontaminating it. The invention is well-suited for use in a meat processing plant, but can also be used in other industries where fluid treatment is necessary.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, particularly a tractor loader backhoe, which prevents the boom from being rotated downward by its own weight. The lock device includes an engaging member, an engaged member, and a guide member, which work together to lock and release the boom, ensuring the safety and stability of the machine during operation.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that can be adjusted to regulate suction efficiency during cleaning. The platform has a central, suction portion that can be raised or lowered to adjust the spacing between the platform and the pool bottom. The apparatus also includes inboard and outboard roller assemblies that can be adjusted to maintain the platform in a spaced relationship with the pool bottom. The invention can be used with existing pool cleaning devices and can be adjusted to accommodate pools with suction sources of varying capabilities.

<summary>
The present invention is a wear bushing retriever apparatus that allows for the retrieval of a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing without the need to remove the drill bit. The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that is slidably attached to the mandrel and has protruding members that engage with the wear bushing to retrieve it. The retriever section is designed to have vertical play, allowing it to float along the length of the mandrel, which prevents damage to the wear bushing or the apparatus during the retrieval process.

<summary>

The invention is a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage. The tool has a modular design with stacked pistons that increase the power delivery to the stuck fish. The dump valve is annularly shaped, allowing wireline access without slamming against a seat. The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, and the power stroke can be engaged near the upper end of piston movement. The tool can accommodate longer strokes and can be used in stimulation or fishing operations. The tool has a rotational lock between the mandrel and housing for torque transmission. The design eliminates cyclical impacts on opening and closing, reducing wear and increasing the life of the tool. The tool can be matched to the power required for the particular work string or surface equipment available. The tool has a simple and cheap plug that can be dropped into position to seal the lower end of the passage. The tool's design allows for longer trouble-free service and fewer moving parts.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a retaining wall system that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site. The system consists of a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece. The face panel and counterfort are connected to the base using a shear key and grout. The system can be used in various applications, including retaining soil, sand, pebbles, or rocks. The invention also includes features such as drainage openings, rebar, and a shear key to provide additional stability. The system can be used in combination with H-piles or a cast-in-place pile cap to provide a stable foundation. The invention also includes a vehicle impact barrier that can be formed on top of or behind the wall.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a downhole heating system for improving oil and gas well production by heating the production zone to increase flow. The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, a heat insulating packer, and a stainless steel tubing collar to contain the heat and prevent it from being lost. The heating unit is designed to focus heat on the production formation, rather than just the production tubing, and is protected from physical and chemical attack by a cement block and steel fitting assembly. The system is designed to be more effective and reliable than existing downhole heating systems, which often fail due to inadequate protection of electrical components and poor heat containment.

<summary>

The invention is a mechanism for installing and retrieving objects in a well bore, such as a stuck or lost tool. The mechanism includes an outer housing, an inner body, and a collet or spear that can be selectively latched and unlatched to engage and disengage with the object. The mechanism is designed to be controlled by a wire line, allowing for precise positioning and movement. The collet or spear is designed to engage with the object in a variety of ways, including through a collet structure or a spear slip structure. The mechanism includes a latching mechanism that allows for controlled movement of the collet or spear, and a spring-loaded system that helps to maintain the collet or spear in a latched position. The mechanism can be used for a variety of downhole service operations, including installation and removal of downhole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools. The mechanism can be latched and unlatched multiple times without the need to remove it from the well bore. The mechanism is designed to be adjustable, allowing for precise positioning and movement. The invention is intended to be used in a wide variety of applications, including oil and gas wells, and other industries where downhole operations are performed.

</summary>

<summary>

The patent application describes a method for manufacturing composed stave floors, which are composed of a base substrate and a sight substrate. The sight substrate is typically made of wood and has a thickness of 2-3 mm, which can lead to deformation and detachment over time. The invention aims to solve this problem by using a thicker sight substrate (at least 4 mm) and multidirectional holding means to join the base and sight substrates. The multidirectional holding means include dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means. The invention also provides for a longer lifespan and allows for corrective maintenance. The base substrate has a thickness of at least 12 mm, and the sight substrate can be made of decorative or functional wood. The invention provides a composed stave floor with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties. The floor can be manufactured using various materials and techniques, and the invention is not limited to a specific type of wood or cutting method. The invention provides a solution to the problems of deformation and detachment in composed stave floors.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a ladder attachment that improves the lateral stability of the ladder, prevents it from slipping or sliding, and allows it to straddle corners without losing stability. The attachment includes a flange with a U-bolt that secures the ladder to the work surface, and a resilient pad that grips the work surface without damaging it. The attachment also increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, preventing it from denting, scraping, or maring the surface.

<summary>

The present invention relates to a fastener assembly for use in a fastener driving tool, comprising a row of fasteners arranged substantially parallel to each other, and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners. The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles a shank of each fastener and a connecting portion that extends between and connects adjacent collar portions. The connecting portion includes a bridge and a rib, and the rib has a tapered shape. The collation system is designed to reduce debris generation during driving of the fasteners and to improve the holding power of the fasteners in a substrate. The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin or an epoxy, and is formulated to enhance adhesion to the fasteners and the substrate. The collation system is also designed to provide a uniform and consistent shape and structure, which helps to prevent corrugation of the strip. The invention also includes various embodiments of the collation system, including a coiled configuration and a configuration with a tapered connecting portion.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, to machines and artifacts. The nozzle has a bell-shaped tip and an injection button that provides a non-permanent connection to the bell-shaped section. The nozzle can be connected to a sealant cartridge or injection machine and can be used to apply sealants manually or automatically. The injection button has channels and orifices that allow for precise sealing operations, such as applying sealant to the chamfers of rivet heads or the walls of orifices. The nozzle can be used in various industries, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The invention provides a device that simplifies the sealing process, reduces sealant application time, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application. The nozzle can be used to apply sealants to various parts, including fuel tanks, and can be used in conjunction with traditional truncated-cone shaped nozzles. The invention is intended to provide a more economical and efficient sealing process.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a position sensor that uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify a sensing signal and remove unwanted power. The sensor uses a window reference circuit to constantly compare the desired conditioned sensor signal output to the existing sensor output and adjust the output if it is above or below a preset reference signal. The sensor can be used to monitor the position of an object and can be multiplexed with other sensors to reduce the number of wires required, making it suitable for use in mechanical systems such as internal combustion engines.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is a valve actuation system for an internal combustion engine that eliminates the use of springs and provides a variable valve actuation capability. The system uses a cam and slide assembly to control the opening and closing of the valves, and a circular drive disk with a slotted cam track to adjust the valve displacement. The system can be controlled by a computer to optimize engine performance and fuel efficiency, and can be used in a variety of engine configurations, including four-valve cylinders.
</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a light member for aquariums or other enclosures, which includes a housing with a lighting control region that can be controlled independently to emit different colors and intensities of light. The light member can be controlled manually or remotely using a timer or a remote control, and can be used in various applications, including aquariums, offices, and kitchens.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine. The prior art has cooling channels and separating walls (ribs) cast together, which has several disadvantages. The invention proposes using separate inserts, such as metal or non-metal strips, as separating walls, which can be inserted into the apparatus and secured. This design simplifies production, reduces weight, and allows for easier adjustment of the cooling system. The inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape to deflect the cooling fluid. The invention is particularly suitable for rotor blades in gas turbines, where the complex geometry simplifies the design. The inserts can be secured using holders or material joints, and can be inserted through the blade root or tip. The invention also allows for the use of different materials for the inserts and the apparatus. The cooling channels and separating walls can extend in the radial direction with respect to the rotation axis of the gas turbine.

</summary>

<summary>The present invention is a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control, allowing the vehicle to be operated safely and efficiently in various situations. The system includes a control unit that receives signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve, and can switch to manual control if the automatic control unit malfunctions or is overridden by the driver.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a waste fuel burner that generates heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels such as wood waste. The burner has a primary combustion chamber where the fuel is gasified and a secondary combustion chamber where the volatile gases are burned. The primary chamber has a conical pile of fuel and preheated underfire air that percolates up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel. The volatile gases are then partially oxidized in the primary chamber and the remaining gases are introduced into the secondary chamber where they are fully oxidized. The secondary chamber has a swirl air and secondary combustion air that interact to maintain good separation of particulate from the gas stream. The burner is designed to operate with a low excess air ratio, which reduces the amount of air needed and increases efficiency. The burner can be adjusted to operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and the response time is less than 1 minute. The burner produces a clean exhaust gas that can be used for industrial purposes or as a boiler feed. The burner has a unique flame holder that prevents particulate from entering the secondary chamber and a pressure isolator that isolates the primary chamber from the secondary chamber. The burner has a control system that adjusts the air and fuel flow based on the BTU demand of the heat consuming process.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is an evaporative cooler that uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding moisture to it. The heat exchanger has a dry side and a wet side, with the dry side being cooled by fresh air and the wet side being cooled by the evaporation of water. The working air used for the wet side is drawn from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air. The cooled air is then circulated back to the room, reducing the temperature and humidity. The system can be configured to recirculate return air or bypass cooled air to increase cooling efficiency. A hybrid system is also described that combines the evaporative cooler with a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool the air. The system is more efficient and uses less energy than traditional vapor compression refrigeration units.

</summary>

<summary>

The patent describes a fluid pump with two or more pump heads in series, each with a housing, impeller, and drive shaft. The pump heads are connected to form a fluid flow path, with the fluid flowing from one pump head to the next. The pump heads are designed to pump fluid at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures. The pump assembly can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer. The pump can be used to pump liquid manure from animal husbandry operations, such as pig farming. The pump has a modular design, allowing for easy maintenance and repair. The pump can be powered by a single motor, with the drive shafts connected through a biconical tubular connector. The pump can be used to pump fluid into a holding tank or other fluid holding apparatus.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to engine compression release brakes and provides a modular engine compression release brake system for less than all engine cylinders. The system includes a hydraulic actuator that is connected to a cam actuated exhaust valve and is controlled by an electronic control module. The actuator is designed to move the exhaust valve to an open position to vent compressed air in the cylinder during engine braking. The system is designed to be modular, allowing customers to choose the amount of braking horsepower they need for a specific application. The invention includes a poppet and spool valve assembly that is used to control the flow of fluid to the actuator. The assembly includes a spool valve member that is moved by the fluid pressure to open or close the actuation fluid passage. The system also includes a piston that is moved by the fluid pressure to open or close the exhaust valve. The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective way to implement engine compression release brakes in an engine.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads caused by events like fan blade-off. The mounting link includes a female link, a male link, and a pin that selectively prevents the relative translation of the links. The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude, allowing the links to translate relative to each other and providing coulomb damping to dissipate energy. This design allows the mounting link to absorb extreme shocks without transmitting potentially destructive loads to the attached structures, reducing the risk of damage or detachment.

<summary>
The invention relates to archery equipment and provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight to achieve perfect balance. The point cap system includes a point cap and a balance pin that can be varied in size to achieve the desired weight, and can be used with various types of arrow points and shafts. The invention also provides a point adaptor and nock cap that can be used to attach arrow points and nocks to the arrow shaft without allowing dirt to enter the shaft and without damaging the shaft.

<summary>

The invention is a small arms firing effect simulator that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without using live ammunition. The device is designed to be used with an M16 rifle and is packaged to resemble a magazine clip. The simulator uses a pyrotechnic charge that is ignited by an electrical current, producing a rapid increase in pressure that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire. The device has a reusable housing that contains the electrical control circuitry and the pyrotechnic charge, and is designed to be inserted into the M16 rifle in the same way as a magazine clip. The device has a bolt interface that simulates the action of the weapon's bolt, and a trigger interface that simulates the action of the trigger. The device also has a firing counter and a firing decoder that control the firing of the pyrotechnic charge. The device is powered by a battery and has a MILES interface that allows it to be used with a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System. The pyrotechnic charge is contained in a plastic expendable that is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, reducing cost. The device is designed to be reusable and can be used multiple times. The invention provides a cost-effective and realistic way to simulate small arms fire for training purposes.

</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves engine performance by utilizing the dynamic effect of air flow while reducing noise from the air intake. The device includes a tank, a first pipe, and a second pipe that define air passages between the tank and the intake passage. The first pipe has a larger cross-sectional area than the second pipe, and the second pipe opens to the air intake passage at a location nearer the air cleaner than the first pipe. A control valve is disposed in the first pipe and is actuated by an actuator in response to engine operating conditions. The valve is controlled to open or close based on engine speed and load conditions to optimize engine performance. The device also includes a resonator effect that absorbs noise from the air intake. The resonator effect is achieved by the volume of the tank and the narrow passage of the second pipe. The valve operating conditions are stored as a map in a control circuit and are based on engine speed and throttle position sensors. The device improves engine performance by creating a new compound curve of volumetric efficiency and reduces noise from the air intake.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a mounting bracket for attaching a speaker or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. The bracket consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that can be connected and adjusted to mount the equipment at a desired angle. The stationary bracket has a flat rear panel and two side walls with hooks and apertures, while the adjustable bracket has a top surface and side walls with flexible wings and tabs. The brackets can be connected and adjusted to mount the equipment on a pole or wall, and can be secured with screws and wing nuts. The bracket can also be used to mount a speaker to a pole or wall, and can be adjusted to direct the speaker's sound in a particular direction. The invention is designed to be easy to use and install, and can be used to mount a variety of equipment, including speakers, lighting, signage, and displays. The bracket is also designed to be weather-resistant and can withstand wind and vibration. The invention is suitable for use in a variety of applications, including outdoor and indoor settings.

</summary>

<summary>

The present disclosure relates to a burner for a heat utilizing appliance, which is designed to be efficient, clean, and modular. The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall, with a fuel holder and air inlet opening. The burner also has a shroud that surrounds the outer wall, providing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and an external surface that is cool to the touch. The burner has legs that hold the combustion chamber above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan that can be moved to a deployed or stowed position. The burner also has a cover that can be opened or closed to prevent accidental ignition of objects or exposure to heat and fumes. The burner can be used with various modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers. The pyrolyzer can be used to pyrolyze carboniferous materials, such as vegetation, and produce vaporized products that can be used as fuel or collected for later use. The burner can also be equipped with a fuel feed feature that allows for continuous, long-term operation. The burner is designed to be efficient, clean, and modular, making it suitable for use in a variety of applications.

</summary>

<summary>
The text describes a problem with traditional rotary internal combustion engines, where the cooling system can lead to thermal distortion and structural failure of the engine's housing. The problem is caused by the in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses, which disrupts the flow of coolant and creates hot spots. The invention proposes a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses, which improves the flow of coolant and reduces the risk of thermal distortion. The staggered arrangement also increases the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44%, making it more efficient. The invention is designed to improve the cooling system of rotary internal combustion engines, reducing the risk of structural failure and improving engine performance.

<summary>
The invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance by maintaining the total mass flow through parallel turbine inlet control valves constant. The method involves determining the flow characteristics of each valve and using a compensation circuit to adjust the flow through the remaining valves to compensate for the loss of flow due to the closed valve. The compensation circuit uses a "look-up table" to determine the flow compensation required based on the mass flow demanded by the turbine. The method has been tested and shown to reduce pressure excursions by 95% compared to a control valve test without flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water emerging from the outlet passage, ranging from 0% water, 100% soap solution to 100% water, 0% soap solution. The valve system includes a spool valve, flow restricting device, and seal rings to control the flow of fluids and maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure. The arrangement includes at least one compressor, heat exchanger, and valve-controlled pipelines. The compressor station is designed to operate differently depending on the season, with a different configuration during summer and winter months. During summer operation, the station uses expansion turbines to cool the gas, while during winter operation, the station operates in parallel mode with the compressors. The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution than traditional re-cooling technology, with a 40-45% reduction in investment costs. The invention also reduces the risk of accidents by eliminating the need for re-cooling units. The compressor station can be designed to operate with a single or multiple compressors, and the expansion turbines can be replaced with throttling devices if necessary. The invention is particularly useful for long-distance gas pipelines with a diameter of 56 inches and operating pressures of 75 or 100 bar.

</summary>

<summary>
The text describes a system for eliminating the need for fasteners to secure a cooling fan to an enclosure. The system uses a motor carrier with mounting legs that have resilient leg portions that compress and expand to secure the fan to the panel. The fan is installed by positioning it against the panel, applying a compressive force to compress the spring members, and then rotating the fan to secure it in place. This design allows for a secure and vibration-resistant connection between the fan and the panel without the need for fasteners.

<summary>

The invention is a damped kinematic mount designed to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The mount is used in spacecraft structures to support precision instruments and sensors. The current kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration and shock, leading to instrument failure. The invention incorporates a damping mechanism into the mount to dissipate vibration energy and reduce the impact of flight loads. The damping mechanism can be achieved through various designs, including a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper. The damped kinematic mount can be used in a variety of configurations, including a truss structure and a center-of-gravity mounting system. The invention provides a significant improvement in damping performance, with modal vibration tests showing damping values of 5-17% of critical damping. The damped kinematic mount can be used in a wide range of applications, including precision instruments and sensors.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a large oil shear type clutch unit used in an aircraft catapult system, designed to transmit high horsepower and minimize residual drag. The clutch unit has a novel design with interleaved clutch plates and discs, and separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment, which allows for maximum torque transmission and cooling. The unit also features a centrifugal oil flow system that retracts the discs and reduces residual drag, making it suitable for high-speed and high-power applications.

<summary>
The invention describes a novel internal combustion engine that uses a combination of combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders to achieve high thermal-to-mechanical efficiency. The engine uses water injection to cool the combustion cylinders and extract heat energy, which is then used to power the expansion cylinders. The engine is designed to eliminate the need for a radiator and to reduce exhaust emissions, with the goal of achieving a thermal-to-mechanical efficiency of 94-96%.
</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a method for fabricating a precoated steel plate with a precoat comprising an intermetallic alloy layer and a metal alloy layer. The precoat is formed by dipping the steel plate in a molten bath of an aluminum alloy. The plate is then cut into a desired shape and size. The metal alloy layer is removed from the periphery of the plate to prevent the introduction of the precoat into the molten area during welding. The plate is then welded to another plate using a continuous welding process, such as laser beam welding or electric arc welding. The welded joint is then heated to form a surface alloy and undergo austenizing and quenching to produce a part with good mechanical properties. The part can be cooled under controlled conditions to produce a martensitic, bainitic, or bainitic-martensitic microstructure. The invention provides a method for fabricating a precoated steel plate with good corrosion resistance and mechanical properties.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a remote control system for a mobile energy recovery structure that optimizes energy extraction from severe weather patterns. The system includes a central service facility, a mobile structure, and a control and communications microprocessor system. The mobile structure can be a sailing vessel or a propelled vessel, and it is equipped with sensors and control circuits that provide data to the control and communications microprocessor system. The system uses a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) algorithm to optimize energy extraction and navigation of the mobile structure. The SCADA algorithm uses data from various sources, including GPS, weather satellites, and sensors on the mobile structure, to determine the optimal path for the mobile structure to follow. The system also includes a graphical user interface (GUI) that allows a human operator to monitor and control the mobile structure remotely. The GUI provides a virtual reality representation of the mobile structure's attitude and position, as well as a weather map with path analysis lines that show the optimal route for the mobile structure to follow.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together and welded. The ring segments are punched out from a sheet metal material and have an axial profiling formed by forming techniques. The ring element is suitable for manufacturing radial and axial bearing cages, including groove and angular ball bearings. The invention aims to reduce production costs by minimizing cutting waste and improving the welding process.

<summary>

The invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates associated with the location. A service technician visiting a customer service location is provided with an input device for receiving and transmitting information related to a disruption or interruption of service. The input device is configured to access a technician server, which is in communication with a global positioning satellite system (GPS) and a dispatch system. The GPS system is used to track, dispatch, and monitor service technicians and their input devices at numerous customer service locations. The dispatch system is used to receive, process, and transmit information related to service required at one or more customer service locations. The system also includes an address guide system, which includes a database of universal type address information, and a customer record system, which includes a database of customer-related information. The system can be used to provide driving directions to a service technician from a first location to a second location where customer service is to be performed. The system can also be used to update the latitude and longitude information associated with a customer service location. The system can be implemented using a computer-readable medium, such as a memory device or a data signal transmitted on a carrier wave. The system can be used to facilitate the provision of customer service by providing accurate and up-to-date information related to customer service locations.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields. The system has two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The control unit combines the output signals of the two sensors to virtual sensor signals, which are then processed by independent control loops to generate control signals for the coils. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields. The control unit can also account for feedback effects between two compensation systems installed directly beside each other. The system can be used in various applications, such as imaging systems using magnetic fields, and can be designed to be broadband, selective concerning a frequency range, or selective concerning a frequency. The system can also be used in a double installation, where two systems are operated directly beside each other.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering (CARS) microscopy. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site in the sample by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner. The bioorthogonal reaction is a chemical reaction that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes. The reaction partner can be introduced into the sample and react with the intrinsic chemical structure to form a resonance site. The sample is then introduced into a CARS microscope, where it is investigated and a signal is sensed. The signal is used to derive at least one structural property of a chemical structure containing the resonance site. The invention allows for the creation of resonance sites in samples that do not inherently possess them, and can be used to improve the sensitivity and specificity of CARS microscopy.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is a system for comparing and evaluating the quality of segmentations of medical images, particularly in radiation therapy, by analyzing the differences between two segmentations of the same structure and providing a quantitative evaluation of the comparison. The system allows for the customization of the comparison process through the use of different metric methods and provides a graphical and quantitative output to assist in the evaluation of the segmentations.

<summary>
The patent describes an invention that accelerates the execution of floating point subtraction operations in a data processing system. The invention calculates a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments and uses this difference to begin the subtraction operation before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is determined. The subset difference is used to determine the correct resulting fraction, which is available when the complete difference is determined and the current procedure is determined to be incorrect. The invention reduces the number of steps required to perform the subtraction operation, making it faster and more efficient. The patent also describes the apparatus and method for implementing the invention, including a block diagram of the apparatus and a flowchart of the method.

<summary>

The invention is a method and system for tracking specimens collected from patients in a medical facility. The method includes storing a patient's information and a unique patient barcode number in a database, and generating a unique order barcode number for each specimen collection order. The method also includes inputting the patient's barcode number, order barcode number, and blood drawer's barcode number into a computer, and storing them in a relational manner in the database. The method further includes inputting the barcode number of each specimen vial and storing it in a relational manner with the other barcode numbers in the database. The system includes a computer, a barcode reader, and a database storage, and the method can be used to track the collection of blood specimens and other types of specimens. The system can also be used to track the time it takes to collect the specimen and to alert the blood drawer if the collection time exceeds a predetermined time. The invention can help to reduce errors and improve the efficiency of the specimen collection process.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, which uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide distance and other information to the user. The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and uses a bone conductance vibration sensor to pick up the user's voice. The device can also provide pre-recorded golf instructions and allow the user to record and upload golf course data. The device can be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be expanded to include features such as Bluetooth connectivity and a serial connection to a personal computer. The device can also be used to provide expert system advice to the user, based on their past performance and the course layout. The device can be powered by a battery and has a speaker and microphone for audio output and input. The device can be used to record and upload golf course data, and can be used to provide information on the distance to the green, pin placement, and other course features.

</summary>

<summary>

The present invention is a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports errors for logic and memory regions in a system-on-chip (SoC) integrated circuit design. The system uses customized design rules for different types of memory regions, such as BDSP, BLSP, DP, and ROM, to eliminate false errors and improve design verification. The method involves identifying different regions in a mask pattern data and applying the appropriate design rules to each region. The system checks the design against both logic and memory rules, and the output is a design rule check result file that includes only real logic and real memory errors. The invention eliminates the need for manual checking and manual filtering of errors, making it a more efficient and reliable method for design verification. The system can be applied to any mask pattern database, including those with multiple types of memory blocks.

</summary>

<summary>The invention describes a waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator that uses a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, to provide controlled illumination of objects, including holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs). The WGH illuminator offers advantages such as high diffraction efficiency, compact size, and reduced stray light, but also has limitations, including alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, and two-sidedness, which can be addressed through various techniques.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, particularly squirrel cage rotors. The apparatus includes a test head with a core and windings that produce an alternating magnetic field, and a rotor test fixture with a spindle and retraction mechanism. The rotor is placed on the spindle and retracted to the test position, where it is rotated by a drive motor. The test head senses the rotor's induced voltage and skew, and a data acquisition and processing system acquires and processes the data. The system calculates the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective skew, and compares them to predetermined threshold values. If the values are within the thresholds, the rotor is passed as good; otherwise, it is rejected. The system also stores statistical data on the tests and displays the results on a display. The retraction and drive mechanism is powered by a hydraulic cylinder, and the rotor is held in place by a clutch mechanism. The invention is designed to be efficient and cost-effective, with a dual fixture system that allows for simultaneous testing of two rotors.

</summary>

<summary>

The text describes a method for securing a computing device, such as a mobile device, by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library only if a digital certificate associated with the managed library is validated. The managed library is a set of instructions that can be executed within a virtual machine, and the digital certificate ensures that the instructions have been scrutinized by a trusted developer. The method also denies access to native resources to a managed application if the application includes a digital certificate authorizing it to access a specific native resource through the managed library. The managed application is stored in a digitally signed container, and the container is checked to ensure that it has not been tampered with. The method also includes verifying a digital signature associated with the container and loading the managed application. The managed application can be terminated if it attempts to access native resources or managed libraries for which it has not been authorized to access.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers and then laminated between two rigid outer layers. The card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage and is made using a unique structure that disseminates external forces over a broad area, reducing the risk of damage. The card is made by pre-shrinking a core layer, printing artwork and attaching an antenna and IC chip, and then bonding the core layer to a bottom layer with an adhesive. The core layer and bottom layer are then sandwiched between two polymer layers, which are fixedly secured to the core layer and bottom layer with an adhesive. The card can be personalized with inkjet printing or dye diffusion thermal transfer methods, and a protective layer can be applied to protect the variable indicia. The card is designed to be durable and easy to manufacture, with a unique structure that provides improved protection for the electronic components.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a memory implementation of a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) queue using a tree-shaped data structure. The tree is balanced and all leaf nodes are at the same level. The queue is implemented by adding and deleting records from the tree, with each update requiring a copy of the path from the root to the point of updating. The invention also includes a header node that can be used to implement a double-ended queue, allowing additions to be made to the beginning and deletions to be made from the end of the queue. The header node can also be used to invert the queue, allowing the queue to be used as a Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) queue. The invention can be implemented in a memory arrangement with a control logic that manages the queue and a memory that stores the tree structure and records. The control logic can add and delete records from the queue, and update the tree accordingly. The invention can be modified to have a variable maximum size for the nodes, and the records can be stored in a separate memory area.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to electrically programmable read-only memory (EPROM) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies. The EPROM devices use the same manufacturing processes as dynamic random access memory (DRAM) devices, which allows for the integration of EPROM and DRAM devices on the same wafer. The EPROM devices use the hot carrier effect or gate voltage stress to alter the properties of transistors, allowing data to be stored and retrieved. The EPROM devices have several advantages, including the ability to be manufactured using existing IC technologies, low cost, and high storage density. The devices are ideal for embedded applications and security applications where data must be stored securely.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a method of determining feedback gain for a control system, particularly for an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) running along a predetermined course. The method involves executing feedback control using a provisional gain value, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and adjusting the gain value to minimize the evaluation value. The evaluation value is calculated using functions that evaluate the stability, accuracy, and response of the control system. The gain values are determined for each section of the course, and the optimum values are obtained by function interpolation or by causing the AGV to run continuously along the course. The method can be used to determine the proportional (P), integral (I), and differential (D) gains for a PID control system. The invention provides a simple and efficient method for determining the optimum gain values, which can be used to improve the performance of the control system. The method can be applied to various control systems, not just AGVs, and can be used to determine the optimum gain values for different control systems.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a zoom lens with a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio, suitable for use in photographic cameras and video cameras. The lens is designed to have a small size, with a total length of 9.13φA to 9.19φA, while maintaining high optical performance. The lens consists of five lens units, including a first lens unit with positive refractive power, a second lens unit with negative refractive power, a third lens unit with negative refractive power, a fourth lens unit with positive refractive power, and a fifth lens unit with a combination of positive and negative refractive powers. The lens is designed to satisfy specific conditions to achieve good correction of aberrations, including spherical aberration, coma, and chromatic aberration. The invention provides a compact and high-performance zoom lens that is suitable for use in various applications, including photography and videography.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like, in a detector. The method and device enable both the detection of individual particles and the integration of multiple particles, allowing for the detection of particles at high rates or frequencies without knowing in advance the signal rates to be expected. The device includes a detector, a first amplifier for amplifying individual signals, a second amplifier for integrating signals, and a support capacitor to rapidly compensate for discharging of the detector. The invention is useful in various fields, including particle accelerators, medical technology, and electrical power engineering.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is an automatic spin checking apparatus for testing driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and a servo motor. The driven disc assembly is installed on a hub and frictionally engaged between the rings. The apparatus measures the distance between the rings and the rotation of the hub to determine if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances. The apparatus automatically determines if the assembly is good or bad and generates an external indication to the operator. The operator can install another assembly for testing after the apparatus has finished testing the current one. The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control. The invention is an improvement over prior art spin checking apparatuses because it is automatic, efficient, and generates external indications of the test results.

</summary>

<summary>

The text describes a face age-estimation system that uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) to extract feature vectors from face images. The system is trained on a database of landmarked faces and uses support vector machines (SVMs) to build aging functions and an age classifier. The CAM algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from the face images, which are then used to train the SVMs. The system can distinguish between youths and adults and uses different aging functions for each group. The aging functions are used to estimate the age of a face, and the system can provide a single age or a set of ages with corresponding confidence factors. The system can also be used to recognize faces and determine their age. The text also describes the mathematical equations used to build the aging functions and the age classifier. The system can be used in various applications, such as security cameras, surveillance systems, and age-based access control.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images. The device includes a controller that produces display light intensity signals for each pixel, and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels. The merged image is formed by combining the light intensity signals of the two images, with each pixel receiving a signal from either the first image, the second image, or a combination of the two. The device can be used to display a first image, such as a monochrome image from a night vision sensor, merged with a second image, such as graphical or textual information. The device can be implemented using a dedicated hardware architecture, such as a matrix of pixels with two controllers, to minimize power consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
